00102 template <typename T, wxFileOffset start_offset = 0 >
00103 class SerializedFile {
00104 public:
00105 
00106         // typedefs
00107         typedef uint64_t size_type;
00108         typedef size_type IdType;
00109 
00110         // error codes
00111         enum SerializedFileError {
00112                 ERR_NONE = 0,   
00113                 ERR_BAD_SEEK,   
00114                 ERR_BAD_WRITE,  
00115                 ERR_BAD_READ    
00116         };

00126         SerializedFile(const wxFileName &filename, size_t buffer_size = 4096) :
00127                 m_filename(filename),
00128                 m_buffer_valid(false), m_dirty(false), m_lastError(ERR_NONE),
00129                 m_buffer_size(record<T>::size * buffer_size)
00130         {
00131                 // ensure that this is as big as expected
00132                 wxASSERT_MSG(sizeof(wxFileOffset) >= 8, wxT("Your compiler does not support 64-bit offsets"));
00133                 
00134                 // create a new file if it doesn't exist, otherwise open existing file
00135                 if (!wxFileExists(filename.GetFullPath()))
00136                         m_file.Open(filename.GetFullPath(), wxT("wb+"));
00137                 else
00138                         m_file.Open(filename.GetFullPath(), wxT("rb+"));
00139 
00140                 m_buffer = new unsigned char[m_buffer_size];
00141                 m_buffer_end = &m_buffer[m_buffer_size];
00142                 memset(m_buffer, 0, m_buffer_size);
00143                 
00144                 assert(m_buffer);
00145         }
00146         
00147         ~SerializedFile()
00148         {
00149                 delete [] m_buffer;
00150                 m_file.Close();
00151         }
00152         
00154         bool Delete() 
00155         {
00156                 m_file.Close();
00157                 return wxRemoveFile(m_filename.GetFullPath());
00158         }
00159         
00161         bool IsOpened() const
00162         {
00163                 return m_file.IsOpened();
00164         }

00180         wxString GetErrorString() const
00181         {
00182                 switch (m_lastError) {
00183                         case ERR_BAD_SEEK:
00184                                 return _("Error while seeking");
00185                         case ERR_BAD_WRITE:
00186                                 return _("Error while writing");
00187                         case ERR_BAD_READ:
00188                                 return _("Error while reading");
00189                         default:
00190                                 break;
00191                 }
00192                 return wxT("");
00193         }

00201         IdType GetLastId() const
00202         {
00203                 assert(m_file.IsOpened());
00204                 wxFileOffset len = m_file.Length();
00205                 
00206                 if (len < start_offset)
00207                         return 0;
00208                 
00209                 return (len - start_offset) / record<T>::size;
00210         }

00213         void SetBufferSize(const size_t buffer_size)
00214         {
00215                 size_t new_size = record<T>::size * buffer_size;
00216         
00217                 // assume that the copy isn't worth it
00218                 if (new_size != m_buffer_size)
00219                 {
00220                         m_buffer_size = new_size;
00221                         
00222                         delete [] m_buffer;
00223                         m_buffer = new unsigned char[new_size];
00224                         m_buffer_end = &m_buffer[new_size];
00225                         memset(m_buffer, 0, m_buffer_size);
00226                         m_buffer_valid = false;
00227                 }
00228         }

00237         size_type LoadObjects(const IdType &start_id, const size_t count, T * dst)
00238         {
00239                 size_t i = 0;
00240                 wxFileOffset bytes_read;
00241                 unsigned char * buf_ptr;
00242 
00243                 IdType first_read_id = start_id;
00244                 
00245                 assert(m_file.IsOpened());
00246                 assert(dst);
00247 
00248                 if (m_dirty)
00249                 {
00250                         m_file.Flush();
00251                         m_dirty = false;
00252                 }
00253         
00254                 // first, see if the start_id is in the current page
00255                 // TODO: It could be faster if we tried to detect if the range
00256                 // fell *within* our range, and load it that way..
00257                 if (m_buffer_valid && m_buf_start_id <= start_id && m_buf_end_id > start_id)
00258                 {
00259                         // reset this: this is safe, since we checked the bounds
00260                         buf_ptr = &m_buffer[(start_id - m_buf_start_id) * record<T>::size];
00261 
00262                         // copy out the current page
00263                         do
00264                         {
00265                                 dst[i++] = T(record<T>::deserialize(buf_ptr));
00266                         }
00267                         while ((buf_ptr += record<T>::size) < m_buffer_end && i < count);
00268 
00269                         first_read_id += i;
00270                 }
00271 
00272                 // always seek -- its not guaranteed that the file pointer
00273                 // will be where we want it. worst case, extra function call
00274                 if (i < count)
00275                 {               
00276                         // this shouldn't happen, but if it does...
00277                         if (!m_file.Seek(start_offset + first_read_id * record<T>::size))
00278                         {
00279                                 SET_BAD_ERROR( ERR_BAD_SEEK );
00280                                 return 0;
00281                         }
00282                                 
00283                         m_buf_end_id = first_read_id;
00284                 }
00285                 
00286                 m_lastError = ERR_NONE;
00287                 
00288                 while (i < count)
00289                 {
00290                         m_buf_start_id = m_buf_end_id;
00291                 
00292                         // read the items page by page
00293                         bytes_read = m_file.Read(m_buffer, m_buffer_size);
00294 
00295                         // ensure that it actually read something
00296                         if (bytes_read == wxInvalidOffset || !bytes_read)
00297                         {
00298                                 SET_BAD_ERROR( ERR_BAD_READ );
00299                                 break;
00300                         }
00301 
00302                         // calculate the end id
00303                         m_buf_end_id = m_buf_start_id +  bytes_read / record<T>::size;
00304                         
00305                         // reset this
00306                         buf_ptr = m_buffer;
00307                 
00308                         // copy out the current page
00309                         do
00310                         {
00311                                 dst[i++] = T(record<T>::deserialize(buf_ptr));
00312                         }
00313                         while ((buf_ptr += record<T>::size) < m_buffer_end && i < count);
00314                 }
00315                 
00316                 // let it be known that this is indeed valid
00317                 m_buffer_valid = true;
00318                 
00319                 return i;
00320         }

00333         size_t SaveObjects(const IdType &start_id, const size_t count, const T * const src)
00334         {
00335                 size_type i = 0;
00336                 unsigned char * buf_ptr;
00337                 
00338                 size_t to_write;
00339                 
00340                 assert(m_file.IsOpened());
00341                 assert(src);
00342         
00343                 // this shouldn't happen, but if it does...
00344                 if (!m_file.Seek(start_offset + start_id * record<T>::size))
00345                 {
00346                         SET_BAD_ERROR( ERR_BAD_SEEK );
00347                         return 0;
00348                 }
00349                 
00350                 // partial validation of the buffer
00351                 m_lastError = ERR_NONE;
00352                 m_buffer_valid = true;
00353                 m_buf_end_id = start_id;
00354                 
00355                 do
00356                 {
00357                         // set these up
00358                         m_buf_start_id = m_buf_end_id;
00359                         buf_ptr = m_buffer;
00360                 
00361                         // setup the current page
00362                         do
00363                         {
00364                                 record<T>::serialize(src[i++], buf_ptr);
00365                         }
00366                         while ((buf_ptr += record<T>::size) < m_buffer_end && i < count);
00367                         
00368                         // calculate write size
00369                         to_write = (size_t)(buf_ptr - m_buffer);
00370                         
00371                         // adjust end id
00372                         m_buf_end_id += to_write / record<T>::size;
00373                         
00374                         // write the buffer
00375                         if (m_file.Write(m_buffer, to_write) != to_write)
00376                         {
00377                                 // adjust the count and exit -- invalidate the buffer
00378                                 i -= to_write/record<T>::size;
00379                                 m_buffer_valid = false;
00380                                 SET_BAD_ERROR( ERR_BAD_WRITE );
00381                                 break;
00382                         }
00383                 }
00384                 while (i < count);
00385                 
00386                 // set the dirty flag
00387                 m_dirty = true;
00388 
00389                 return i;
00390         }
